I’m to curious for my own good
Gold IV?
Wait. Why does its say "Get jelly with Sally “yougelly” Ye, a **challenger** mid lane monster and League Partner Program streamer." then?
that's better than 80% of players so she might be sort of interesting to watch.  then again streamers are supposed to be fun and interesting personalities
There is no way gold is better than 80% of people lol. At most 60%  . also her op.gg says gold, unless I am looking at the wrong account.
So.. It says "Yougelly? You Will be." If these stats are right.. She's a 47% winrate hard stuck gold.. How is this person a rising star I'd want to watch? Lmaoooo. Who cares about this noob.

"Rising star" as in a streamer with a growing fanbase.

People primarily watch streamers because they like the streamer's personality and find them entertaining.

videogamedunkey is my favorite league of legends player

You should do a Creator spotlight on him!
Please riot? I'll be looking for it
Also.. "So look forward to getting entertained more and more, and different kinds of content" Terrible use of commas. Shoo, unintelligible Asian.
She spoke it out loud; someone else transcribed it...

In a world that base their everything over impressions (judgements) what did you expect us to believe, here. She's just a face and her content is going to be generic crap... otherwise people will look at top ladder streamers because they bash their heads in to get there... some of them are good, but they mostly just spent more time. The rare few that are actually reallllllly good at your game rarely get lucky enough to get through before frustration makes them KNOW they shouldn't stick around. Remove the luck factor from your matchmaking and create differences between "lucky" players and good ones. Lucky ones wont be stick around higher elos than they deserve:

Simple to fix this, really: create Actually tiers into divisions diamon 3 GOOD players (best stats/position) vs BAD players (baaaad stats). Per division (gold / diamond) the standards change... objective damage may matter more than deaths, but make an overall belief of what a good player looks like and give these players More LP and lose Less LP for bad players : Lose more and win less until they match the division's good players or just get back to their respective ranking.

LP loss/gain is based on your mmr and individual stats. I won't insult you if you think gaining lp for losing games is more comforting than winning a game because you got carried, but you will rank up faster due to higher lp gain if you actually play at a higher level like you suggest. This is the same system that gets applied to people who have such high mmr that they skip a rank after winning their series. The system will do its part to aid or hinder players who consistently play at a higher/lower skill level with respect to their current rank. What you are asking for is a system that rewards players that consistently lose more games than they win. You should just 
"git gud." {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

They got boosted to gold in solo/duo, 3s, and is currently Iron in flex, a disgusting Yasuo main. Its kind of obvious because all Yasuo players that I've seen are all sub toxic individuals that think that they're a god. Same with Aatrox, Irelia, Jax, Master Yi, Tryndamere, Zed players.
So basically any champion that is annoying to play against has a toxic player base. Makes sense {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

I don't get this. How is this person a rising star? I haven't heard anything about this person until this commercial promotion on the Riot Games client. Is this something that Riot plans on doing more frequently?
Uhhhh...okiee?
{{champion:7}} !
Why is this advertised as a "Challenger" player when she's low gold for the last four seasons, and going.

Many years ago, I watched my favorite game company <Blizzard> slowly killing their games by making poor decisions, losing millions of players.

In 2018 we witnessed <EA> and <Bethesda> ruined their own franchises, and put a bad name on themselves.

Those 3 companies has made enough money till the point that they don't care about their creation their products anymore, threw away the name they've spent years to build. they've lost their passion and love for their games and the appreciation for their customers, FOCUSED ON MICRO TRANSACTIONS while giving players poor gameplay experiences.

League is right now my favorite esport game and I hope Riot really can make this game better and better.

Honorable mentions: Valve, Rockstar and Obsidian.
